data.title: All of Scarlett Johansson's movies, ranked
data.meta_description: The actress was nominated in two acting categories at the 2020 Oscars for her roles in "Marriage Story" and "Jojo Rabbit."
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Scarlett Johansson is known for movies like "The Avengers" and "Lost in Translation."

She's also garnered numerous award nominations over the years, most recently for her roles in "Marriage Story" and "Jojo Rabbit."

Insider ranked every one of her 50 movies according to critical consensus on Rotten Tomatoes.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

Scarlett Johansson received two Oscar nominations this year, but her vast filmography has been growing since 1994.

Today, the actress has 50 acting credits under her belt, but some of her projects have received better critical reception than others.

Here are all of the movies that Johansson has appeared in, ranked according to critics' scores on Rotten Tomatoes.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Abby Monteil contributed to an earlier version of this article.

Advertisement

50. Johansson had a small role in the 1997 romantic drama "Fall."

Synopsis: "Fall" follows a tumultuous relationship between a cab driver and a supermodel.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 0%

Advertisement

49. She made her film debut in the 1994 film "North."

Synopsis: "North" follows a young boy who goes on a journey across the world in search of new parents.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 14%

Advertisement

48. Critics weren't impressed by Johansson's 2008 superhero film "The Spirit."

Synopsis: This neo-noir superhero film focuses on a reborn police officer determined to fight crime.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 14%

Advertisement

47. The actress starred alongside her future "The Avengers" costar, Chris Evans, in the 2004 comedy "The Perfect Score."

Synopsis: A group of enterprising teenagers break into a testing center in order to nail their upcoming SATs.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 16%

Advertisement

46. She played a young art student in the 1996 romantic comedy "If Lucy Fell."

Synopsis: This rom-com focuses on two roommates who make a pact to jump off the Brooklyn Bridge if they dont' find love before they turn 30.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 18%

Advertisement

45. Johansson was the daughter of Sean Flannery's character in the 1995 crime thriller "Just Cause."

Synopsis: A Harvard professor uncovers more than he bargained for when he takes on the case of a wrongly accused man.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 26%

Advertisement

44. In the 1997 film "Home Alone 3," she starred as lead character Alex Pruitt's (Alex D. Linz) older sister.

Synopsis: Much like the other "Home Alone" movies, this one focuses on a young boy who has to defend his home from intruders.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 29%

Advertisement

43. Johansson tackled the neo-noir genre in the 2006 film "The Black Dahlia."

Synopsis: The infamous Black Dahlia murder case and the effect it had on those who investigated it is the focus of this film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 32%

Advertisement

42. The actress played a nanny working for an affluent family in the 2007 movie "The Nanny Diaries."

Synopsis: A recent college grad struggles with her new job as a nanny.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 34%

Advertisement

41. Johansson starred in the 2004 romantic comedy "A Good Woman."

Synopsis: High society drama and a complicated relationship between a mother and daughter are the focus of this period film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 37%

Advertisement

40. She and Ewan McGregor costarred in the 2005 science fiction thriller "The Island."

Synopsis: Set in the future, this movie focuses on a man struggling to escape his dystopian society.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 40%

Advertisement

39. In the 2006 movie "Scoop," Johansson played an American journalism student uncovering a story in London.

Synopsis: A young journalism student goes undercover to break a big story.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 41%

Advertisement

38. The actress appeared with Ben Affleck and Jennifer Aniston in the 2009 romantic comedy "He's Just Not That Into You."

Synopsis: This rom-com focuses on numerous characters all facing relationship or romantic troubles.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 42%

Advertisement

37. She was the historical figure Anne Boleyn in the 2008 historical drama "The Other Boleyn Girl."

Synopsis: The Boleyn sisters vie for the affections of King Henry VIII in this historical drama.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 43%

Advertisement

36. Johansson joined John Travolta in the 2004 drama "A Love Song for Bobby Long."

Synopsis: A young woman forms a dysfunctional family with two squatters after she discovers them living in her mother's New Orleans home.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 43%

Advertisement

35. Fans protested Johansson's casting as the lead in the 2017 science fiction film "Ghost in the Shell," because the original manga character is Asian.

Synopsis: This manga adaptation follows a woman who becomes a super warrior following a tragic accident.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 43%

Advertisement

34. The actress played a politician celebrating her bachelorette party in the 2017 comedy "Rough Night."

Synopsis: A group of friends' night out doesn't exactly go as planned in "Rough Night."

Rotten Tomatoes score: 45%

Advertisement

33. She joined the 2002 monster movie "Eight Legged Freaks."

Synopsis: After being exposed to toxic waste, a group of monstrous spiders threaten a small Arizona town and everyone living there.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 48%

Advertisement

32. The actress starred in the 2001 biographical drama "An American Rhapsody."

Synopsis: After being reunited with her family, a girl from Eastern Europe struggles to determine where she fits in the world.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 56%

Advertisement

31. She played "Psycho" actress Janet Leigh in the 2012 drama "Hitchcock."

Synopsis: Set in the 1950s, this period piece focuses on the relationship between famous director Alfred Hitchcock and his wife.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 60%

Advertisement

30. Johansson's first lead role was runaway tween Amanda in the 1996 comedy "Manny and Lo."

Synopsis: Two sisters kidnap a woman and force her to help them after the eldest sister becomes pregnant.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 62%

Advertisement

29. The actress was a zookeeper in the 2011 family comedy "We Bought a Zoo."

Synopsis: An optimistic man relocates his family in order to save and restore a struggling zoo.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 65%

Advertisement

28. In the 2014 science fiction movie "Lucy," Johansson played a woman who gained supernatural abilities.

Synopsis: A woman with newfound telekinetic abilities takes revenge on her attackers.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 67%

Advertisement

27. The actress voiced Mindy in the 2004 animated comedy "The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie."

Synopsis: Spongebob Squarepants and Patrick Star track down King Neptune's stolen crown, with help from some familiar faces along the way.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 68%

Advertisement

26. She was a peasant maid-turned-muse in the 2004 historical drama "Girl With a Pearl Earring."

Synopsis: In "Girl with a Pearl Earring," Johansson plays a young woman who falls in love with the famous painter Vermeer after joining his home as a maid.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 72%

Advertisement

25. Johansson voiced a porcupine in the 2016 animated film "Sing."

Synopsis: This animated film follows a theater owner who hopes to save his business through a singing competition.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 72%

Advertisement

24. She first appeared as the well-known Marvel character Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow in the 2010 superhero film "Iron Man 2."

Synopsis: This action-packed sequel to the first "Iron Man" sees Tony Stark struggling with his new identity as a superhero.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 72%

Advertisement

23. Johansson starred alongside Robert Redford in the 1998 drama "The Horse Whisperer."

Synopsis: After a terrifying accident, a young girl and her horse learn to heal, with the help of a talented expert.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 74%

Advertisement

22. The actress reprised her role as Black Widow in the 2015 movie "Avengers: Age of Ultron."

Synopsis: The Avengers take on the recently-awakened villain Ultron in this Marvel film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 76%

Advertisement

21. She joined Hugh Jackman and Christian Bale in the 2006 thriller "The Prestige."

Synopsis: Two magicians in 19th-century London battle for domination, but encounter unexpected setbacks along the way.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 76%

Advertisement

20. Johansson starred in the 2005 psychological drama "Match Point."

Synopsis: A retired tennis player embarks on a passionate affair with his brother-in-law's fiancée.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 77%

Advertisement

19. In the 2013 romantic comedy "Don Jon," the actress appeared with Joseph Gordon-Levitt.

Synopsis: Gordon-Levitt plays a sex-addicted New Jersey bartender who's forced to re-examine his outlook on life after meeting a new woman.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 79%

Advertisement

18. Johansson earned an Oscar nomination for her performance in the 2019 satirical comedy "Jojo Rabbit."

Synopsis: Taiki Waititi's controversial film follows a young Nazi sympathizer whose life gets infinitely more complicated when he discovers a Jewish girl hiding in his home.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 80%

Advertisement

17. She appeared in the 2001 crime film "The Man Who Wasn't There."

Synopsis: A conniving barber attempts to blackmail his wife and her lover in this film from the Coen Brothers.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 81%

Advertisement

16. Johansson was part of a love triangle in the 2009 romantic drama "Vicky Cristina Barcelona."

Synopsis: Two American best friends have a sultry, sexy time in Spain with an impassioned painter and his ex-lover.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 81%

Advertisement

15. The actress starred in the 2004 comedy "In Good Company."

Synopsis: Satirizing corporate culture to a T, "In Good Company" follows a middle-aged executive whose life is complicated when a new boss arrives.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 83%

Advertisement

14. She was part of the massive cast of the 2019 movie "Avengers: Infinity War."

Synopsis: The Avengers take on the infamous, all-powerful Thanos and try to save the universe in "Infinity War."

Rotten Tomatoes score: 85%

Advertisement

13. Johansson played an alien in the 2014 science fiction thriller "Under the Skin."

Synopsis: A mysterious alien woman seduces and kills unwitting men in this chilling sci-fi film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 85%

Advertisement

12. She starred as a 1950s actress in the 2016 comedy "Hail, Caesar!"

Synopsis: Set in 1950s Hollywood, this film follows the stars of a major film studio as they avoid scandal and maintain their reputations.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 85%

Advertisement

11. The actress appeared in the 2014 movie "Chef."

Synopsis: A disillusioned chef abandons his restaurant career for a food truck in this feel-good film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 87%

Advertisement

10. She was a show dog named Nutmeg in the animated film "Isle of Dogs."

Synopsis: In this Wes Anderson film, a young boy in Japan travels to a mystical island in order to find his lost dog.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 90%

Advertisement

9. Johansson joined Chris Evans and Sebastian Stan in the 2014 superhero movie "Captain America: The Winter Soldier."

Synopsis: Black Widow and Captain America team up to take on the infamous Winter Soldier.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 90%

Advertisement

8. She reprised her role as Natasha Romanoff in the 2016 film "Captain America: Civil War."

Synopsis: Two of Marvel's most famous superheroes — Captain America and Iron Man — face off in this action film.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 90%

Advertisement

7. The actress played one of "Earth's mightiest heroes" in the 2012 blockbuster "The Avengers."

Synopsis: In this Marvel film, well-known superheroes like Thor, Black Widow, and the Hulk come together to defeat the evil Loki and prevent him from taking over the world.

Rotten Tomatoes score: 92%

Advertisement

6. She and Thora Birch costarred in the 2001 comedy "Ghost World."

Synopsis: Two best friends struggle with post-graduation burnout and different worldviews in "Ghost World."

Rotten Tomatoes score: 93%

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement
